009package Ch04_Filters;
010
011import ij.ImagePlus;
012import ij.gui.GenericDialog;
013import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
014import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
015import imagingbook.common.ij.DialogUtils;
016import imagingbook.common.image.OutOfBoundsStrategy;
017import imagingbook.common.image.access.ImageAccessor;
018import imagingbook.core.jdoc.JavaDocHelp;
019import imagingbook.sampleimages.GeneralSampleImage;
020
021import java.util.Random;
022
023import static imagingbook.common.ij.IjUtils.noCurrentImage;
024
025/**
026 * <p>
027 * ImageJ plugin -- Jitter filter implemented with {@link ImageAccessor}, allowing uniform access to all image types.
028 * Works for all image types, using nearest-border-pixel strategy. The input image is destructively modified. See Sec.
029 * 4.7 (Exercise 4.14) of [1] for additional details.
030 * </p>
031 * <p>
032 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer
033 * (2022).
034 * </p>
035 *
036 * @author WB
037 * @version 2022/09/23 added out-of-bounds strategy
038 * @see ImageAccessor
039 * @see OutOfBoundsStrategy
040 */
041public class Jitter_Filter_ImageAccessor implements PlugInFilter, JavaDocHelp {
042        
043        /** The filter radius. */
044        public static int R = 3;
045        /** The out-of-bounds strategy to be used (see {@link OutOfBoundsStrategy}). */
046        public static OutOfBoundsStrategy OBS = OutOfBoundsStrategy.NearestBorder;
047
048        /** Constructor, asks to open a predefined sample image if no other image is currently open. */
049        public Jitter_Filter_ImageAccessor() {
050                if (noCurrentImage()) {
051                        DialogUtils.askForSampleImage(GeneralSampleImage.Flower);
052                }
053        }
054
055        @Override
056        public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus im) {
057                return DOES_ALL;
058        }
059
060        @Override
061        public void run(ImageProcessor ip1) {
062                if (!runDialog()) {
063                        return;
064                }
065
066                final int w = ip1.getWidth();
067                final int h = ip1.getHeight();
068                final int d = 2 * R + 1;        // width/height of the "kernel"
069
070                ImageProcessor ip2 = ip1.duplicate();
071                ImageAccessor ia1 = ImageAccessor.create(ip1);
072                ImageAccessor ia2 = ImageAccessor.create(ip2, OBS, null);
073
074                Random rnd = new Random();
075                
076                for (int u = 0; u < w; u++) {
077                        for (int v = 0; v < h; v++) {
078                                int rx = rnd.nextInt(d) - R;
079                                int ry = rnd.nextInt(d) - R;
080                                // pick a random position inside the current support region
081                                float[] p = ia2.getPix(u + rx, v + ry);
082                                // replace the current center pixel in ip1
083                                ia1.setPix(u, v, p);
084                        }
085                }
086        }
087
088        private boolean runDialog() {
089                GenericDialog gd = new GenericDialog(this.getClass().getSimpleName());
090                gd.addHelp(getJavaDocUrl());
091                gd.addMessage("Filter kernel size is (2r+1) x (2r+1):");
092                gd.addNumericField("Kernel radius (r > 0)", R, 0);
093                gd.addEnumChoice("Out-of-bounds strategy", OBS);
094
095                gd.showDialog();
096                if (gd.wasCanceled())
097                        return false;
098
099                R = (int) gd.getNextNumber();
100                OBS = gd.getNextEnumChoice(OutOfBoundsStrategy.class);
101                return true;
102        }
103        
104}
